intro: Tetraria ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetraria, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces tiny, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Tetraria ligulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its ecological niche.
